net.sf.sprockets.servlet.http

Class JsonServlet<I,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • net.sf.sprockets.servlet.http.JsonServlet<I,O>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - type of JSON object that will be POSTed/PUT and deserialised as the input object. Can be Void to skip deserialisation.
    O - type of object that will be serialised to the response in JSON format. Can be Void to skip serialisation.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Servlet, ServletConfig

    public abstract class JsonServlet<I,O>
extends HttpServlet
    Deserialises POSTed/PUT JSON objects and serialises your objects to the response in JSON format. Override any of the json* methods to handle requests. The Content-Type response header is set to application/json; charset=UTF-8.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
